column20: gratify and charm, usually in order to influence; the political candidate worked the crowds""
column21: make something, usually for a specific function; She molded the rice balls carefully"; "Form cylinders from the dough"; "shape a figure"; "Work the metal into a sword""
column22: move into or onto; work the raisins into the dough"; "the student worked a few jokes into his presentation"; "work the body onto the flatbed truck""
column23: make uniform; knead dough"; "work the clay until it is soft""
column24: use or manipulate to one's advantage; He exploit the new taxation system"; "She knows how to work the system"; "he works his parents for sympathy""
column25: find the solution to (a problem or question) or understand the meaning of; did you solve the problem?"; "Work out your problems with the boss"; "this unpleasant situation isn't going to work itself out"; "did you get it?"; "Did you get my meaning?"; "He could not work the math problem""
column26: cause to undergo fermentation; We ferment the grapes for a very long time to achieve high alcohol content"; "The vintner worked the wine in big oak vats""
column27: go sour or spoil; The milk has soured"; "The wine worked"; "The cream has turned--we have to throw it out""
column28: arrive at a certain condition through repeated motion; The stitches of the hem worked loose after she wore the skirt many times""
column29: shaped to fit by or as if by altering the contours of a pliable mass (as by work or effort); a shaped handgrip"; "the molded steel plates"; "the wrought silver bracelet""

column2: twist and press out of shape
column3: twist and compress, as if in pain or anguish; Wring one's hand""
column4: obtain by coercion or intimidation; They extorted money from the executive by threatening to reveal his past to the company boss"; "They squeezed money from the owner of the business by threatening him""
column5: twist, squeeze, or compress in order to extract liquid; wring the towels""
